results.title: Napoleon Bonaparte and the Battle of Austerlitz
results.creator_credit: Phil Grabsky and Seventh Art Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Great commanders”.
Napoleon remains one of the most enigmatic and skillful military leaders the world has ever seen. Exploiting the turmoil of the French Revolution, Napoleon was able to eventually become Emperor of France and then set his sights towards the rest of Europe. At the Battle of Austerlitz, Napoleon was able to command a victory against Austria and Russia.

results.title: Hinduism
results.creator_credit: David Millar, James Beveridge and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Great Religions”.
In India, the home of most present adherents, this film traces the history of Hinduism, its evolution over the centuries and its connections to Buddhism and Jainism. Shown are the observances of this faith, its teaching of non-violence, its respect for all living things, how the social order created by it has been modified in the modern world to outlaw the declaration of individuals as “untouchables” and to remove limitations on freedom imposed by caste.

results.title: The Drug takers
results.creator_credit: Pauline Shaw and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Facts Are These”.
A study of drug misuse among the young people of a typical urban area. Considers the social acceptability and medical uses of certain types of drugs and the effects of some drugs on the workings of the body. An ex-addict discusses his experiences. Finally a psychiatrist warns of the dangers inherent in casual experimentation.

results.title: Alexander the Great and the Battle of Issus
results.creator_credit: Phil Grabsky and Seventh Art Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Great commanders”.
Alexander the Great had conquered all of the then known world by the time of his death at 32. At the Battle of Issus, he led a charge across a river to crush a massive Persian force. Alexander’s military genius allowed him to employ daring strategems and from his victory at Issus, he went on to become one of the greatest commanders of all time.

results.title: Love now pay later
results.creator_credit: Pauline Shaw and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Facts Are These”.
An introductory description of the increasing incidence of venereal disease. A consultant surgeon of a London VD Clinic explains the range of causative factors.

results.title: Contraception
results.creator_credit: Pauline Shaw and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Facts Are These”.
The most important aspect of family planning is to avoid the unwanted child. Baroness Birk describes to young people the irresponsibility of creating such a child and the damaging psychological, radical and social effects on both the child and the parents. Advice for young people on all types of sexual matters is provided by Family Planning Association Clinics and Brooke Advisory Centre. An animated sequence on the mechanic of conception is included.

results.title: The Global Economy
results.creator_credit: Monash University, Open Learning Agency of Australia and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: An Open Learning University video course in Economics. This series examines some of the questions concerning contemporary students of Economics and International Relations. Each episode incorporates a round-table panel discussion by international economists who discuss the issues and themes introduced.

results.title: The Evolving world (NP)
results.creator_credit: Ashley Schwall-Kearney, Craig Saunders, Open Learning Agency of Australia, Monash University and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “The Global Economy”.
This episode of The Global Economy focuses on the changing nature of the world’s various economies by considering two examples: China as a developing economy (Passing on development) and the USA (Continual change, continual growth) with its dominance of the computer software industry. A panel of economists discuss the nature of change in the local market place and the effects this creates globally.
